intro: Paranephelium muricatum, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and distinctive floral structure. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to Central and South America. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are often heart-shaped and have a velvety texture due to the dense covering of fine hairs. Paranephelium muricatum is often found in disturbed habitats and can be an invasive species in certain regions.
